page.title: 03Darland School, Rossett
page.content:
Darland School is an 11-16 mixed comprehensive school. At 16+ pupils can continue their education in Yale Sixth Form College, Wrexham, or at the North East Wales Institute, Plas Coch, Wrexham.
The school is made up of two blocks. The first block (Allington-Horsley) was built in 1958. The first headmaster ,Mr Bellis, was with the school from 1958 until 1977. The school first opened with 200 pupils and 8 teachers.
Originally the Assembly Hall doubled as a gym but in 1972 the second block (Burton-Trevalyn) and a gym were constructed. In 1972 there was an increase in pupils and staff when the school changed from being a secondary modern school to a comprehensive.
